item.title: Projects
item.description:
Current

  • This site: I’m still working on adding content to this site and developing its theme.
  • University of Michigan Fencing Club Website (Spring 2016 - present): I became webmaster in 2016 and realized that the site was difficult to update, edit, and keep consistent. I rebuilt the site Summer 2016 using Hugo to allow for easy updates, consistent theming, templating, and easy contributions from teammates. Source.
  • Hugo club-theme (Summer 2016 - present): The Hugo theme and layout template for the UMFC website and suitable for any student organization or club’s website. A heavily modified fork of key-amb/bootie-docs.

Past

  • chromeos-resize (Summer 2016): A script to easily resize partitions on Chrome OS devices, typically used for dual-booting. Built with Eric Hegnes.
  • Hackatron (Septermber 2015): Real-time in person help and mentorship tool built for hackathons, offices, and schools. Built with Christian Stewart at MHacks 6. Screencast
  • iHW-Android (Fall 2014 - Spring 2015): A schedule app for Harvard-Westlake. I’m the 2014-15 developer and am almost finished with my AppCompat redesign.
  • LivingPlanet (December 2014): My submission to and a finalist in the 2014 Koding Global Hackathon. A Meteor site built demonstrating issues on our planet. Built with Christian Stewart, James Lennon, Jake Saferstein, & David Woldenberg.
  • openpad (Fall 2014): A platform for using Andoid & iOS devices as input devices on C++-capable devices. Built with James Lennon & Jake Saferstein.
  • HW Java networking projects (Fall 2014): ChatServer, HTTPServer.
  • En Garde (Summer 2014): An Android fencing scorekeeper built to be fast, pretty, and functional.
  • HyperTyper (Spring 2014): A typing “aid” (it’s a tool to cheat in games like TypeRacer).
  • Coo: A Minecraft escape map I built with my brother Tommy some years ago.
  • Anything else on my GitHub.

Current as of 2017-01-02.
